channel.title: More data = memory usage?
channel.description:
Sounds like a dumb question but is memory usage supposed to rise when you're using more data for the application/server?
I'm loading all the worldmap objects to the server and using them for object checking/path finding but when they're all loading, the server's memory usage increases by quite a lot. Not sure if this is supposed to happen or perhaps there is a leak?
Memory is at around 20k without the world objects loaded, and 100-140k with them loaded

item.title: More data = memory usage?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

Scape-JAVA:

As Pure_ said, there is most likely a leak within your object loading code. Try using plumbr to locate where the leak is occurring.

I’ve ran Plumbr for a good hour and according to that there is no leaks, yet it’s still pretty high

Read full topic

item.title: More data = memory usage?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:3, topic:540567”]Thanks.

Yeah all of the object data is around 20-25mb, but why the huge increase in memory?[/quote]Maybe the leak is contained within your object data loading code, I would google for more help and further reading regarding this subject.

Read full topic
